meanings.definition: A substance used for construction that hardens and adheres to other materials.
meanings.sent1: The worker mixed the cements to build a sturdy wall.
meanings.sent2: The bag of cements was heavy to carry to the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The cements spilled on the ground, creating a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: The cements of the building held strong against the storm.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cements filled the air at the construction site.

meanings.definition: To make something stronger or more solid.
meanings.sent1: She cements the pieces together to form a solid structure.
meanings.sent2: The glue cements the broken vase back into one piece.
meanings.sent3: His hard work cements his reputation as a reliable worker.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship cements over shared experiences and trust.
meanings.sent5: The handshake cements their agreement to work together.

meanings.definition: To establish a firm relationship or connection.
meanings.sent1: The team cements their bond through teamwork and support.
meanings.sent2: Regular communication cements the relationship between the two companies.
meanings.sent3: Their shared love for music cements their friendship.
meanings.sent4: The treaty cements the alliance between the two nations.
meanings.sent5: The shared goal cements their commitment to the project.
